TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Clayey-skeletal, mixed, superactive Ustic Haplocryalfs

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Diamante extremely gravelly loam, forested. (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
O1--1 inch to 0; forest litter in various stages of decomposition.
A1--0 to 2 inches; light brownish gray (10YR 6/2) extremely gravelly loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak very fine granular structure; soft, friable; many very fine and fine roots; many very fine pores; 50 percent pebbles and 20 percent cobbles; neutral (pH 6.8); abrupt smooth boundary. (2 to 5 inches thick)
A21--2 to 14 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) extremely gravelly sandy loam, light brownish gray (10YR 6/2) moist; weak very fine granular structure; soft, friable; many very fine and few medium and coarse roots; many very fine pores; 70 percent pebbles and 15 percent cobbles; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear smooth boundary. (10 to 20 inches thick)
A22--14 to 31 inches; very pale brown (10YR 7/3) extremely gravelly sandy loam, light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) moist; weak very fine granular structure and single grained; soft, friable, many very fine, fine, and few medium roots; many fine pores; 75 percent pebbles and 10 percent cobbles; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear wavy boundary. (10 to 20 inches thick)
B21t--31 to 40 inches; light (7.5YR 6/4) very gravelly sandy clay, brown (7.5YR 5/6) moist; strong fine and very fine subangular blocky structure; very hard, very firm, sticky and plastic; many moderately thick clay films on faces of peds; few very fine and fine roots; common very fine pores; 50 percent pebbles and 10 percent cobbles; medium acid (pH 5.6); gradual wavy boundary. (8 to 12 inches thick)
B22t--40 to 60 inches; light yellowish brown (7.5YR 6/4) extremely gravelly sandy clay, yellowish brown (7.5YR 5/4) moist; weak medium and fine subangular blocky structure; very hard, very firm, sticky and plastic; thin patchy clay films on faces of peds; few very fine pores; 50 percent pebbles and 15 percent cobbles; medium acid (pH 5.6).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Rio Arriba County, New Mexico; NE1/4 SE1/4 section 7, T.21N., R.12E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Mean annual soil temperature is 40 degrees to 44 degrees F. and the mean summer soil temperature is about 50 degrees F. Depth to the top of the argillic horizon is greater than 24 inches and depth to the base of the argillic horizon is 60 inches or more. Rock fragments range from 45 to 90 percent in a major part of the solum and the C horizon, and they are mainly less than 10 inches in diameter. Reaction of the profile ranges from neutral to medium acid.
The A1 horizon has value of 5 or 6 dry, 3 or 4 moist, and chroma of 2 or 3. It is sandy loam or loam and has 15 to 60 percent gravel and 10 to 30 percent cobbles.
The A2 horizon has hue of 7.5YR or 10YR, value of 7 or 8 dry, 5 or 6 moist, and chroma of 1 through 3. It is very light sandy loam or loamy sand and has 40 to 70 percent gravel and 10 to 30 percent cobbles.
The B2t horizon has hue of 5YR or 7.5YR, value of 4 through 7 dry, 3 through 5 moist, and chroma of 3 through 8. It is sandy clay or cobbly clay and has 50 to 70 percent gravel and 10 to 30 percent cobbles. It has angular or subangular blocky structure.
Some pedons have a C horizon that has hue of 5YR or 7.5YR, value of 5 through 7 dry, 4 or 5 moist, and chroma of 4 through 6. It usually is light clay or clay loam and has 10 to 20 percent stones and 30 percent cobbles.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Bundo, Etoe, Etown, Marosa, Mortenson and Tigeron (T) series. Bundo, Etoe, Marosa and Tigeron soils have less than 35 percent clay in the family control section. Etown soils have Bt horizons at depths of less than 24 inches. Mortenson soils have montmorillonitic mineralogy.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  The Diamante soils are on strongly dissected, moderately steep to very steep very old alluvium that is several hundred feet thick. Elevations range from 8,000 to 9,800 feet. The mean annual precipitation ranges from 18 to 25 inches. Mean annual air temperature is 38 degrees to 40 degrees F. and average summer temperature is 50 degrees F. Frost-free season is 90 to 110 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Jaroso, Maes and Trampas soils and the competing Etoe soils. Jaroso soils have cryic temperature regimes. Maes and Trampas soils have the upper boundary of the argillic horizon at depths of less than 24 inches.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium runoff; moderately slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Timber production, rangeland, wildlife habitat, recreation and watershed. Vegetation is mainly Douglas-fir, white fir, limber pine, scattered ponderosa pine, and an understory of shrubs and grasses.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Mountain areas of northern New Mexico and possibly Colorado, Utah and Wyoming. The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Taos Area, New Mexico, 1976.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U. S. A.
